{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient is a 17-year-old girl who has not undergone puberty yet, while her classmates have. This suggests a delay in sexual development. On examination, she has undeveloped breasts and is in Tanner I stage of development. This indicates that her estrogen levels are low. Low estrogen levels can be caused by a deficiency in the aromatase enzyme, which converts androgens to estrogens. Therefore, the likely additional finding in this patient is A. Aromatase enzyme deficiency.", "answer_choice": "A"}
